text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia subrigida is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Phyllodineae. It is native to an area in the  Wheatbelt, Mid West and Goldfields-Esperance regions of Western Australia.The erect shrub typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 metres (3 to 10 ft). It blooms from August to October and produces yellow flowers.
